title: Ticket #376: remote_ attributes disappearing from Condor-C job ads
description:
If a Condor-C job ad contains remote_foo and remote_remote_foo attributes, the ad submitted to the next schedd may not have a remote_foo attribute (which should be copied from remote_remote_foo).

This is a bug in how the CondorJob class in the the gridmanager translates the local job ad into an ad for remote submission. The original ad is first copied wholesale to form the new ad. Then, the original ad is searched for remote_* attributes. For each one, a new attribute is inserted in the new ad with the 'remote_' stripped off and the original attribute name is deleted from the new ad.

If the original ad has both remote_foo and remote_remote_foo, and remote_remote_foo is found first, then the translated remote_foo will be deleted when remote_foo from the original ad is processed.
remarks:
2009-Apr-13 12:22:09 by jfrey:
The solution I'm using is to delete all remote_* attributes from the new ad before translating remote_* attributes from the original ad.

2009-Apr-13 12:27:23 by jfrey:
This same code is in INFNBatchJob, but it doesn't delete any remote_* attributes from the new ad. Now it does in the same way as CondorJob.
